About Netskope
Today, there's more data and users outside the enterprise than inside, causing the network perimeter as we know it to dissolve. We realized a new perimeter was needed, one that is built in the cloud and follows and protects data wherever it goes, so we started Netskope to redefine Cloud, Network and Data Security. 
Since 2012, we have built the market-leading cloud security company and an award-winning culture powered by hundreds of employees spread across offices in Santa Clara, San Francisco, Seattle, Bangalore, London, Melbourne, and Tokyo. Our core values are openness, honesty, and transparency, and we purposely developed our open desk layouts and large meeting spaces to support and promote partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. From catered lunches and office celebrations to employee recognition events (pre and hopefully post-Covid) and social professional groups such as the Awesome Women of Netskope (AWON), we strive to keep work fun, supportive and interactive.  Visit us at Netskope Careers and follow us on Twitter @Netskope and Facebook. 
 
About the role:
The Corporate Endpoint Engineer will report to the IT Systems Architect and will be based in our Santa Clara HQ office.  This role will be responsible for delivering a positive user experience with productivity and security as a priority.  Strive for zero-touch provisioning for Netskope’s global workforce.
Responsibilities:

Troubleshoot and remediate issues with endpoints, apps, and security vulnerabilities.
Create solutions and automate processes for deployment to corporate issued devices.
Respond in a timely manner to service issues and requests using a ticketing system.
Liaison with the Security team to provide fast response to known vulnerabilities.
Provide support to end users across the company with users in different timezones.
Collaborate with IT team members in different regions.
Manage systems to track inventory and assets.
Setting up and managing user accounts and access to applications.
Vendor negotiations and IT inventory management.
Ensure all requests are logged, processed and document changes.
Perform regular environmental assessment to ensure the continued enhancement and modernization of the end user computing environment.
Collaborate with other teams for incident response activities; ensure timely remediation of outage(s), perform root cause analysis, and develop/implement long-term solutions to mitigate future risks.

Requirements/Qualifications:

5+ years of experience with device and systems management tools.
5+ years of experience in device configuration management in a corporate environment.
Experience with Mobile Device Management (MDM) tools, including Kandji/Jamf/Intune/Google MDM.
Experience with managing and administration in an Active Directory environment
Solid understanding of Mac OSx and Windows Operating Systems.
Strong understanding of  Mac security configurations and Windows hardening standards.
Knowledgeable of various scripting methodologies such as Bash, PowerShell, and Python.
Knowledgeable of automated onboarding, offboarding, and general workflows.
Working knowledge of cloud applications like Gsuite and O365.
Setup and support audio/visual conferencing tools with Zoom.

Preferred Qualifications:

Apple Certified Support Professional
Microsoft Certified Desktop Administrator
Okta Certified Administrator

Additional Skills:

Work independently with little supervision.
Excellent in identifying problems and providing solutions.
Effectively communicate with users with varying technical backgrounds.
Ability to work after hours and weekends.

 Education:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in a relevant discipline 
Related network and security certifications are a plus
